Meaning: Anonymized worker identifier
The unique identifier for the relation.
The name of the batch that the item occurred in
The source of the relation.
The genre that the text comes from.
The original language that the text was uttered in.
The reference label (wikipedia and PDTB relations only)
The non-sampled majority label
The first argument of the relation embedded in its context.
The second argument of the relation embedded in its context.
The first connective phrase that the participant provided (free text)
The second connective phrase that the participant provided (forced choice)
The connective phrase that the firstinput was mapped to
The level 3 relation label that the firstinput was mapped to
The level 2 relation label that the firstinput was mapped to
The level 1 relation label that the firstinput was mapped to
The connective phrase that the secondinput was mapped to
The level 3 relation label that the secondinput was mapped to
The level 2 relation label that the secondinput was mapped to
The level 1 relation label that the secondinput was mapped to
Whether the participant's insertion matched the majority label
The participant's overall accuracy score, based on agreement with the reference labels
The participant's overall accuracy score, based on agreement with the majority labels
The participant's quality score, output from IRT
The participant's quality score, output from CrowdTruth (measures the overall agreement of one crowd participant with the other participants)
The participant's worker-worker agreement score, output from CrowdTruth (measures the average pairwise agreement between the participant and all other participants)
The participant's worker-sentence agreement score, output from CrowdTruth (measures the similarity of the annotations of a participant and the aggregated annotations of all other participants)
